intro: Nassauvia glomerulosa f. paradoxa, commonly known as the paradoxical clustered nassauvia, is a rare and unique variant of the species native to specific regions of Mexico. It is characterized by its dense, clustered inflorescences and distinctive foliage, which exhibit subtle variations compared to the typical form. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and requires a sunny to partially shaded environment. Its botanical significance lies in its genetic divergence and potential role in plant systematics. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a valuable subject for ecological and conservation studies.
